function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of data privacy and security in the collection and analysis of sensitive and personal data through iot and big data technologies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through the interconnected smart systems and devices","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of standards for secure iot device integration and data exchange","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of control over data collected by private entities","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of universal standards for data management","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Public mistrust of private sector involvement in data management","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate data privacy and security measures in smart city infrastructure could lead to unauthorized access to sensitive medical information","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of alignment between ppps and the actual needs of the cities may lead to ineffective implementation of smart city and safe city projects","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited funding capacity of cities may lead to reliance on ppps, which could introduce challenges in ensuring equity, affordability, and accessibility of smart city and safe city services for all residents","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Privacy, control, and propaganda issues arising from the implementation of smart and safe city concepts","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Security loopholes and threats posed by smart grid, automated building systems, unmanned aerial vehicles, and iot-enabled sensors","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerability of data leading to espionage and financial exploitation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Physical damage to installed devices and systems due to data access","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fear and discomfort among citizens due to surveillance and data privacy concerns","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Heterogeneity of systems impacting trust in smart city concept","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consent for personal data processing in smart city systems","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of policies, standards, and governance for data usage in smart city concepts","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Resistance from the general public towards the coupling of smart city and safe city concepts","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty around data usage in the context of public private partnerships ppp for smart and safe city implementation","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential reliance on proprietary technology as an alternative to addressing privacy and security concerns in smart and safe cities","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Threat to public health and economy due to covid-19","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased monitoring and management of human activities by corporate capitalism","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Transformation of cities through digital technology innovation changes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased dependence on digital platforms due to covid-19, leading to social and cultural reformation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Proliferation of smart city technology and 6g may lead to increased surveillance and privacy concerns","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid advancements in ict and wireless technologies may result in disparities in digital access and broadband speeds","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rapid urbanization leading to a growing number of slum dwellers and inadequate infrastructure and services","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Introduction of new technologies and communication infrastructure","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor coverage in 1g technology","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low sound quality in 1g technology","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of roaming support capacity in 1g technology","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential health complications from 5g infrastructure installations","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cost effectiveness of 5g technology","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contagious diseases propagation related to the proliferation of social media and connectivity","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Proliferation of digitally connected iot devices in smart cities can lead to an increased risk of contagious diseases spreading through these devices.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Data harvesting from citizens, devices, and assets in smart cities can lead to privacy and security risks, including the potential exposure of sensitive personal information.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consistency in the definition of ’smart cities’ can lead to uncertainty and confusion in the implementation of smart city technologies and strategies, potentially hindering effective governance and urban development.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased connectivity and communication may lead to faster propagation of contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases due to increased connectivity and interaction in smart cities.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on private corporations for smart city development","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased population density in urban areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependency on new technologies and digital platforms","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited community engagement and participation","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rapid technological innovation in response to covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Surveillance and monitoring by corporations and governance entities","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Global cooperation and governance challenges in the face of corporate influence","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Relocalised centres and decentralized work environments may lead to increased population density in these areas, posing a risk of contagion and rapid disease spread.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on iot platforms and smart devices for data connectivity creates a potential security risk, as these systems are vulnerable to cyber attacks and data breaches.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased use of non-car movements and micro-mobility may lead to challenges in maintaining hygiene and sanitation in public transportation systems, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of standardized framework for iot device implementation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"}]}
